events.text: "Turn" means the phase where players are choosing their action. "Turn over" is the phase where players are doing their chosen action

actions.text: spawn random object from the PowerupPickup Family
Round Position to nearest tile, incase slight differences in movement add up

children.text: ID = 0 filters for only Player 1 menu
ID = 1 filters for only Player 2 menu
Get matching player and input font

parameters.text: "Choose Action:"&newline&"(   ) Take Powerup"&newline&"(   ) Up  (   ) Left  (   ) Down  (   ) Right"
"Choose Action:"&newline&"(   ) Take Powerup (   ) Use Powerup"&newline&"(   ) Up  (   ) Left  (   ) Down  (   ) Right"

"Action Selected: "&chooseindex(Self.Action, "None", "Accelerate Up", "Accelerate Down", "Accelerate Left", "Accelerate Right", "Throw Powerup Up", "Throw Powerup Down", "Throw Powerup Left", "Throw Powerup Right", "Pick up Powerup")&newline&("(   ) Redo")

"Choose Direction:"&newline&
"(   ) Up  (   ) Left  (   ) Down  (   ) Right"&newline&
"(   ) Back"

actions.text: change position by velocity * tilesize * dt
velocity                              would move: pixels each frame
velocity * tilesize              would move: tiles each frame
velocity * tilesize * dt                 moves: tiles each second     <- we want this
moves player in the opposite direction a little, then rounds position. This ensures the player's new position isn't inside a wall

children.text: (CurrentCheckpoint+1)%CheckpointCount will equal 0 when CurrentCheckpoint is the max, rather than going over the max

actions.text: Pitch shift car sounds based on speed

children.text: 2 players in game but not tutorial, so camera scaling is only necessary in the game

actions.text: make camera zoom out to show both players (can't zoom in, minimum value is one)
make sure ui doesn't scale due to zoom
Car 2 only exists for game layout

children.text: if PowerupType ≠ 0, then that means it's pre-placed value is preserved

events.text: When a random powerup pickup is spawned, if there is already one there, it will destroy the one there instead. This means that around half of powerup spots will be filled at a given time.
